text: Decreased proteasome - mediated degradation in T cells from the elderly : A role in immune senescence .

Induction of NFkappaB is a highly regulated process requiring phosphorylation , ubiquitination , and proteasome - mediated degradation of the cytosolic inhibitor <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: However , examination of proteasome activity in these T cells using fluorogenic peptide assays revealed a significant age-related decline in chymotryptic activity .
These results suggest that a decline in proteasome activity results in a failure to fully degrade <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in the elderly .
event: <extra_id_0> <extra_id_0> Positive_regulation results <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme degrade <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Protein_catabolism degrade <extra_id_1> <extra_id_0> Theme IkappaBalpha <extra_id_1> <extra_id_1>

text: This failure to degrade <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may underlie both the observed decrease in NFkappaB induction and the IL-2 receptor expression in TNF - treated T cells during aging .
Thus , decreased proteasome - mediated degradation may be central to immune dysfunction that accompanies aging .
